title: Elimination of HIV Prevention Programs and Research - Reversing Decades of Progress
summary: Trump administration eliminated Trump's own first-term signature HIV initiative 'Ending the HIV/AIDS Epidemic,' gutted CDC HIV prevention branches, terminated 200+ HIV/AIDS research grants, cut Ryan White program by $239 million, and ended 15-year AIDS vaccine development project. Experts warn cuts threaten to reverse decades of progress against HIV/AIDS epidemic.
keyFacts: Trump's own signature HIV initiative from first term, 'Ending the HIV/AIDS Epidemic (EHE),' eliminated
CDC reductions gutted branches responsible for HIV prevention services
More than 200 federal grants for HIV and AIDS research abruptly terminated
Ryan White HIV/AIDS program budget cut by $239 million (to $2.4 billion)
Eliminated support for dental services, AIDS Education and Training Centers, and demonstration programs
Late May 2025: Ended AIDS vaccine project that had been developing for nearly 15 years
Cut national at-home HIV testing program
Eliminated expert guidance on preventing infant HIV infections
Ended long-running HIV surveys and statistical analysis to estimate national HIV incidence
Cut guidelines on HIV prevention drugs (PrEP)
Experts warn cuts threaten to reverse decades of progress in fighting HIV/AIDS
HIV prevention division being considered for complete elimination
Cuts undermine U.S. goal to end the HIV epidemic
